lines.text: "a secret whispered in a coffee house is as confidential as a headline in a newspaper".
you should have shot off his gun hand.

It wouldn't make any difference. Go ahead, shoot it off and I'll still get you. You shoot out my eyes, and I'll still find you! If you put a bullet in my heart then I'll make a deal with the devil! I'd trade him for just enough time to come back from hell and kill you! You hear me? I'm gonna kill you!

[to Zack, about Matson]
You know, if you ever need a friend... I wouldn't count on that character.
How 'bout we get down to business?
Well I drink much better standing up than sittin'.
Tell me something Mr. Jarrett, how many states would you say you're wanted in?
How many states are there Mr. Thomas?
Oh, I give you a hundred thousand dollars and you'll give me pardon, right? You know in most states I can buy a pardon for five thousand dollars and they'll throw in a governor.
Of course you must be thinking of Rhode Island. This here is Texas.
...And then there are the kids...
Kids?
...All twenty five of them.
Twenty five? You must have the fastest horse in Texas. You'd better have a little more of this to keep your strength up.
I like men who worry about me.
You don't have to worry about me. I'm a great worrier. Sometimes I worry for months on end.

[Talking about a nude portraid of herself]
This was the only thing my husband left me. He was a... connoisseur of art.
It's a shame he didn't leave you any clothes to go with it.
Well if I have to die, I prefer being killed by the hand of a beautiful woman.
If you're not careful, my darling, you might just have your wish.
[first lines]
Take a good look at him. He's the bad guy. And Joe Jarrett - that's me, and Zack Thomas, we're the good guys.
Let's go.
Don't try and talk me out of this loot, Zack. I'm no soft hearted railroad president.
I'm trying to talk you into something. Now this here's a lot of money.
Oh, yeah. Ordinarily a hundred thousand dollars'll be enough for two, but not me. You see, I was born greedy.
But this money's just the beginning, Joe. If my plan works, we'll get a half a million a year.
Why, thank you, Zach.
Now, you want to buy in?
I think I'll quit while I'm ahead. Nothing personal, mind you. No, I'm beginning to like you too. And a man who'd try to con you when he has a gun held on him can't be all bad.
Well, like you just said. I guess you underrated me, Joe.
Nice to have seen you, Mr. Burden.
It is nice to have seen you.
You!
No, not me. Him.
We're in business.
Maybe we're in business.
How do you feel about marriage, Joe?
Fine, but who'd have us?
[pause]
Oh, no, Max. You're not thinking about marriage?
No. Of course not. Why should I think about marriage?
That's why I like you, Max. You got brains. You think like a man.
I'm glad, Joe. Then it doesn't bother you that I'm a woman?
With what you got on, I'd be in trouble if you were a man.
Well, here we go, Prince George.
Yes, sir.
Alright, the show is on.
Alright, men. Let's go.
What do you suggest?
Well, I don't like to louse up a new sporting jacket, but I think... well, maybe you and I, we could settle this between us, you know. Winner take all.
With four for Texas in the mood, they'll have themselves a real fine brood.
[last lines]

[narrating voice over]
Good guys always get married and live happily ever after. If it don't turn out too good, well, Zack and me, we figure we can always light out. And uh... oh, yeah, this is the end.

[from trailer]
In this country, you really need only a little patience and self discipline.
Discipline?
Yes, to know what to give and when to get it. And I must say my dear, you do know when and what.

[from trailer]
If Mr. Thomas every gets tired of me and spends his evenings with other ladies...
You'll cut his own throat.
Captain, help me out, will you? I'm dealing with two mental midgets here. Now, when I say "go", we'll all point to the right. Go!
[they all point in different directions. Joe slaps them]
Go!
